TMData

  • TMData Usage
Back to top

IO#

Input/Output functions for reading and writing to TMData. The user most likely won’t need to invoke any of these functons, as its functionality is contained within TMBaseEnv.

Methods#

from tmbot.core import init_tmdata
tmbot.core.IO.init_tmdata(op_path)#

Checks if all TMData files are present, and downloads them if any aren’t.

Parameters:

op_path (Path) – Path to Openplanet installation folder. Default is “C:/Users/NAME/OpenplanetNext”.


from tmbot.core import write_actions
tmbot.core.IO.write_actions(op_path, action)#

Writes actions to TMData.

Parameters:

  • op_path (Path) – Path to Openplanet installation folder. Default is “C:/Users/NAME/OpenplanetNext”.

  • action (ActType) – Action to write to TMData.


from tmbot.core import write_alt
tmbot.core.IO.write_alt(op_path, reset: bool = None, pause: bool = None)#

Writes data to TMData exchange file.

Parameters:

  • op_path (Path) – Path to Openplanet installation folder. Default is “C:/Users/NAME/OpenplanetNext”.

  • reset (bool) – Buffers a reset to TMData.

  • pause (bool) – Buffers a pause to TMData.


from tmbot.core import get_observations
tmbot.core.IO.get_observations(op_path, enabled: dict, rew_enabled: dict = None)#

Grabs observations from TMData.

Parameters:

  • op_path (Path) – Path to Openplanet installation folder. Default is “C:/Users/NAME/OpenplanetNext”.

  • enabled (dict[str, bool]) – Dictionary describing enabled parameters in observation space.

  • rew_enabled (dict[str, bool]) – Dictionary describing enabled parameters for reward shaping.

Returns:

Observations in dict format.

rew_vars (dict[str, Any]) : Extra observations in dict format. Can be used for reward shaping.

Return type:

obs (dict[str, Any])
